resources.string: Give first dose of appropriate antibiotic- intramuscular injection Ampicillin/Gentamicin recommended, oral Amoxicillin otherwise
Dilute 500mg vial Ampicillin or 2ml vial Gentamicin with 2.1 ml sterile water
Inject 2ml Ampicillin or 1.1 ml Gentamicin into upper arm, thigh, or bottom with sterile needle
If convulsing, treat with anticonvulsant like Diazepam
Diagnosis: Severe pneumonia OR very severe disease
The child is not showing signs of pneumonia or asthma
No antibiotics or bronchodilator needed. Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy
Diagnosis: No signs of pneumonia or asthma
The Normal breathing rate for children between 2 to 12 months is under 50 breaths per minute
The Normal rate for children ages 1â€“5 years is under 40 breaths per minute
The Normal rate for children below 2 months is under 60 breaths per minute
A high-pitched whistling sound associated with labored breathing
The lower ribs on both sides of the chest are pulled in when the child breathes in, even when the child is not crying.
